org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Class ThreadContextTransactionManager.ThreadedTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.ThreadedTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Transaction
    Enclosing class:
    ThreadContextTransactionManager

    protected class ThreadContextTransactionManager.ThreadedTransaction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transaction
    A Transaction that is meant to exist within the context of one thread. There should be no cross-thread transactional data access, only cross-thread state querying.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description

    • Method Detail

      • getCommitId

        public long getCommitId()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Gets the commit ID of this transaction. A transaction has a commit ID if it has been committed. This commit ID is also linked to the time it was created, and can be compared to other transaction IDs to see if this transaction was committed before, during, or after another transaction.
        Specified by:
        getCommitId in interface Transaction
        Returns:
        The transaction's commit ID, or -1 if uncommitted.

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws TransactionException
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Commits the transaction immediately. Transactions are committed atomically and durably, so that the instant this method returns successfully, the caller can be assured that the modifications performed by this transaction have been saved to disk.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface Transaction
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if an error occurred during the commit. The transaction manager will automatically revert the transaction upon a commit error.
        IllegalTransactionStateException - if the transaction has already been committed, reverted, or is revert only.

      • revert

        public void revert()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Reverts the transaction immediately. When a transaction is reverted, the database acts as though all the modifications performed inside the transaction scope never happened.
        Specified by:
        revert in interface Transaction

      • setRevertOnly

        public void setRevertOnly()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Sets the transaction to be "Revert Only". The transaction will continue as normal, but will throw an IllegalStateException if Transaction.commit() is called.
        Specified by:
        setRevertOnly in interface Transaction

      • getTransactionId

        public long getTransactionId()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Gets the ID of this transaction. A Transaction's ID is linked to the time it was created, so a transaction with a higher ID is guaranteed to have been created later. Transaction IDs are also valid across multiple tables.
        Specified by:
        getTransactionId in interface Transaction
        Returns:
        The transaction's ID.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Closes the current transaction. If the transaction has yet to be committed or reverted, the transaction is reverted immediately.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Transaction

      • isCommitted

        public boolean isCommitted()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Returns true if the transaction has been committed.
        Specified by:
        isCommitted in interface Transaction
        Returns:
        true iff the transaction successfully committed.

      • isReverted

        public boolean isReverted()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Returns true if the transaction has been reverted.
        Specified by:
        isReverted in interface Transaction
        Returns:
        true iff the transaction was reverted.

      • putTransactionListener

        public void putTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
